title: Not Reliable
body:
App is not reliable to start vehicle. I had to test it multiple times. I noticed if I don‚Äôt start or run my car for over 24 hours the app won‚Äôt start my car. I talked to the Mercedes company and they said that has nothing to do with the vehicle it is the app. I also tested it on warm days and winter cold days and still nothing consistent. I rely on this app to start my car to warm up but this app prevents me from doing that. It also gives me misinformation about my car. It tells me my car unlock so when I physically checked the car, the car is actually locked. Not a very reliable app!

UPDATE: 7/20/2021
Got a response from Mercedes app to contact their customer service about my issue. When I called and spoke to their agent she was clueless. She told me in order for the feature to work I will need to first start my car via the app then turn off the car. Afterwards I will be able to start the car via the app. This defeats the purpose of having that feature in the app. She didn‚Äôt know how to fix the problem and wanted to escalate it to the next tier  for help. Her only advice was to first start the car. I am highly disappointed with the lack of knowledge and help from especially from an expensive car manufacturer.

title: Terrible App
body:
Not intuitive. Somewhat useful dashboard. Inviting other owners is a maze of confusing loops. Frustratingly bad software in that regard. Once you get in it‚Äôs ok. Has a nice look and feel. Good designers. Subpar user experience with non-intuitive navigation to some useful functions (e.g. remote start). Confusing connection to other apps. A subscription to start your car? Really? 

Pros:
 +good data at your fingertips 
+nice graphics

Cons:
+Confusing sign up - not really self serve
+Help is a phone call - no search - use Google instead 
+Inviting other owners is a joke - truly a root canal of a process 
+While some user functions are good some are buried in a non-intuitive maze
+Starting a car takes far too long and too many clicks. Just let me start my car without all the hurdles 
+Multiple apps in the App Store is confusing to invite family members. 

Overall. Try again Mercedes...this is a fail.

title: Very limited use
body:
13 days into owning my brand new GLS 450,  I got an alert that my coolant was low (this is just after it stalled while I was still moving).  Yep, coolant is low. It‚Äôs next to impossible to find what coolant to put in bouncing from the manual, to this reference over to that one all telling you that you can‚Äôt put non-spec coolant in, but none telling you the right coolant. Find the coolant and go 20 miles from my home and the check engine light comes on. I tried to find any information about the alert on the app or online log in and NOTHING!  I can see my tire pressure and on EVERY screen that my car is unlocked, but ABSOLUTELY nothing about the check engine alert I‚Äôm getting. Never thought I‚Äôd say this... I‚Äôd like my GMC back. The information your car sends is invaluable. This app is only good to lock and unlock your car. Otherwise it‚Äôs a web with 3 basic points of information. Tire pressure, lock status and if any window or door is open. Useless, useless.

And we did contact the dealer. Service was closed - they don‚Äôt work Saturday- and 7 hours later the sales person sent a pic of the Mercedes log I‚Äôd coolant you can only get by ordering online and having 2-4 day delivery. 

Look forward to the update on the in- car software. Would be helpful to not be notified everytime someone opens the door that our third row or second row seat is folded down. YES, I know. I put it down on purpose.

title: Underwhelming
body:
The app itself works ok, but the overall functionality is entirely and utterly underwhelming. Prior to purchasing my 2021 mercedes, I owned a 2017 Ford Explorer. We also have a 2018 Ford F-150. With our Fords, we have an app on our phones that allow us to start the car, but we also have the flexibility to use our key fobs to remote start our vehicles. With the Fords, when it is cold outside, the heated seats and steering wheel automatically come on while the car is warming up. When it is hot, the cooled seats do the same. I could also unlock the car with a keypad so that I didn‚Äôt have to carry any key or phone with me if I so chose. 

With my fancy pants Mercedes, I must fish out my phone, open the app, click the engine button, enter a PIN and wait for my request to be processed before the car will start (I also receive an annoying email that clutters my inbox every time the car starts, stops, locks and unlocks through the app - maybe there is a setting to turn this off). How is it that this app does not provide the functionality to activate the heated seats and steering wheel? To activate the cooled seats? To adjust the climate settings in the car? Why can‚Äôt i just use the key fob to quickly press a button and start the car? I never in my wildest dreams thought that when I purchased an almost $90K car that I would miss the ‚Äúluxury‚Äù of my $50K Ford.

I wish we could set/adjust heat/cooling from the app like other non luxury brands offer. I also wish we could open and close windows from the app as this technology is available for other non luxury brands already.

title: Better than expected
body: After reading all the negative reviews I had my doubts about how reliable this app would be. Heeding recommendations of other reviewers, I had the app configured with our 2020 GLC prior to leaving the dealership. The main function that we use is the remote start.  After almost 4 months, we haven‚Äôt had any connectivity issues except for one time when the app was upgraded automatically, we had to enter user name and password to sync up with the car again.  It isn‚Äôt perfect, as there is a bit of a wait between when you send a command and when the car responds, but considering the complexity of this system, that is to be expected.  I have been pleasantly surprised that this cell based system has managed to work in our garage where cell service is poor. We love the GLC and this app doesn‚Äôt detract from the ownership experience. I‚Äôll take that as a win!

title: App is great...
body:
Love the information app it gives regarding tire pressure, fuel level, temp, etc., but, I‚Äôm sure most would agree that the functionality of the system itself could be upgraded significantly. The fact that I have to have about 1/4 (actually 20%) tank of fuel to remote start car is very annoying. It only allows the car to run for 10-minutes anyway, so why the need for so much fuel to warm the car? Manual wants the engine on my AMG to run at least 5-minutes when below freezing anyway just to get the juices flowing properly, at these temps is when remote start is needed the most, so why make me sit IN the car and run it?
Also, the fact that after remote starting the engine, it won‚Äôt stay running after unlocking the door. EVERY other make of automobiles allows you to get in the car and will use either hitting the brake or trying to put vehicle in gear before in cancels remote start...? Seems like Mercedes of ALL brands wouldn‚Äôt be so far behind on this. The fact that you cannot remote start a Mercedes directly from factory key fob (like every other make), amazes me as well. I understand they have all theses security features in place, but for a $100K+ car, sure seems like remote start would be a pretty standard feature o the fob itself.
